It is extremely disappointing that these leaders in progressive media (Jimmy included) can’t see beyond their petty squabbles to unify behind a strategy that would help the American people.  Jimmy is right that the progressives in the House are just going to throw their support to Nancy Pelosi and get nothing in return.  The Congress has just passed this horrible stimulus package, and we probably won’t see more help when Biden gets in office.  Meanwhile millions of Americans continue to suffer.  It is all so pointless and hopeless.

We've had problems in Australia from a conservative government trying to shut down reporting on the government's immoral and possibly murderous refugee policy. We've had federal police on the orders of the Attorney General raiding journalists who allegedly had leaked documents about Australian soldiers who murdered Afghans (currently now  in the open in early court proceedings). Totally weird not to think of Assange as a publisher/journalist. If you understand his role in redacting and managing what was and wasn't published by The Guardian, NYT Der Spiegel and the Sydney Morning Herald you would accept he is a journalist who also happens to be a publisher (of Wikileaks). Assange also has a long history of writing for Wikileaks and other publications. Sadly the Australian Government has been pathetic in protecting Julian and getting him out of the situation he is in. We should be using powers we have in the Five Eyes relationship. If it were me, I would be closing down US access to communications facilities on Australian territory at Pine Gap and a number on the Western Australian coast. If your government can turn itself inside out to protect Israel and the murder of Kashoggi then your government can bestir itself to do something for possibly its most loyal Five Eyes ally (I would classify Australia as a feudal vassal of the US, much to my disgust, and same as the other Five Eyes - UK, New Zealand, Canada). Two UN rapporteurs have said Assange has been kept and is currently being kept in nothing less than torturous conditions. I think the problem with this guest's definition of journalist is very inadequate in the digital age. We need to redefine what is journalism when literally anyone can claim to be one on YouTube and other platforms. Most of the YouTube lefties would not be classified as journalists, including TYT, and neither would the commentariat on MSM under his definition. There is work to be done there in classifying contemporary journalism, particularly since many non journalists by training work on breaking stories all the time. But, meantime both of you repeated the stupid smears made against Assange (who is on the spectrum btw and has an unfortunate habit of pissing off people he knows as a result - but that's a whole other ball of wool which nevertheless needs to be accounted fofes). Why would you take up the MSM smears against him which originated in CIA bugging (via Spain) of the embassy where he had sought refuge? And of course earlier, via Sweden, with claims that emerged under seriously shady circumstances which were shown to be false at a later date. The former editor of the NYT during Watergate has been terrific in his support of Assange, as has Daniel Ellsberg. An appalling figure has been the editor of The Guardian who had the benefit of publishing the Wikileaks documents and has dumped on Assange ever since and at every opportunity. Not to understand the truly appalling treatment of Assange by the judge overseeing his case is also a breach of his human rights which no one but a small handful of people seem to care about. A very disappointing, offhand treatment of the Assange case by TYT in this segment Cenk.

I once saw this political cartoon where there was a map of the United States of America. In the image, all of the landlocked states were in red with one big word bubble that said "climate change is a myth."
